subject: Re: [junit] Class not found - Swing UI
msgSnippet: ... Hi, This isn t really a JUnit question, but more of a basic Java classpath problem. Google should be able to help, but I would start off something like
messageBody:
2009/5/19 Roman Sokolyuk <romsok.junit@...>:
>
>
> Hi,
>
> JUnit: 3.8
> OS: Mac OS X Leopard
>
> I wrote the following class:
>
> package com.vhousehold.tests;
>
> import com.vhousehold.pojo.FamilyMemberPOJO;
>
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
>
> public class TestFamilyMemberPOJO extends TestCase
> {
> public void testGetFirstName()
> {
> FamilyMemberPOJO familyMember = new FamilyMemberPOJO("Bobby",
> "Drake");
> assertEquals("Bobby", familyMember.getFirstName());
> }
> }
>
> I am trying to run it from the command line with the commands below, but
> first I "cd" to the directory where the class file I want to run is.
>
> java -cp :/Users/<login>/CS/JARS/junit3.8.2/junit.jar:.
> junit.swingui.TestRunner com.vhousehold.tests.TestFamilyMemberPOJO
>
> The GUI comes up but shows an error "Class not found '
> com.vhousehold.tests.TestFamilyMemberPOJO' ".
>
> Could somebody please explain what I am doing wrong?
>
> Thanks.

Hi,

This isn't really a JUnit question, but more of a basic Java classpath
problem. Google should be able to help, but I would start off
something like this:

$ cd /path/to/directory/containing/com/vhousehold/tests
$ ls
com
$ java -cp .:/path/to/junit.jar junit.swingui.TestRunner
com.vhousehold.tests.TestFamilyMemberPOJO

Alternatively, try one of the fine IDEs, which all have good JUnit
integration - the SwingUI has been dropped from JUnit 4.x in favour of
the integration provided by IDE suppliers.

Cheers,

James
